Reviews.Title: “Calistoga California's Best Western is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: Larry V
Reviews.Content: Clean room, friendly staff, and the location is walking distance to downtown Calistoga. It is also close to several wineries. Consider this location when in the Napa Valley!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: mf-sandiego
Reviews.Content: When planning our trip to the Napa Valley, I was having trouble finding motels that were moderately priced -- so many seemed to be low-end budget properties or expensive resorts. And, we aren't crazy about B&Bs because of too many experiences with overly controlling owners or obnoxious fellow guests. So I was happy to find the BW Stevenson Manor and all of its positive reviews. Normally, we don't stay at Best Westerns because the quality tends to be inconsistent -- and we've encountered too many properties in desperate need of renovation. I'm happy to report that the BW Stevenson Manor met most of my expections, and we enjoyed our stay very much. Our King w/balcony room was very spacious. We loved having the microwave, fridge, free wifi, and iPod dock. Our room was also billed as having a "mountain view." Technically, that is correct. You could see the mountains BUT even more prominent was the John Deere dealership. That's not exactly my idea of a scenic view (see attached photos). We did ask to be moved several doors up towards the front of the property so that at least it wasn't a direct view of the tractor yard when we walked in. They accomodated us very nicely with this request, but I do think they should take out "view" altogther from the room descriptions because it implies something good. The continental breakfast had a good variety of options -- bagels, packaged muffins, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal made in a crock pot (very good) with all kinds of toppings, cereals, and a waffle maker. I wasn't a fan of the waffle batter, but I'm pretty picky about that. All in all, this is a well-locate, well-maintained motel that I woujldn't hesitate to stay in again. And if you're a fan of John Deere equipment, you'll love it even more. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Donald B
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our accommodations at Best Western Plus Stevenson Manor in Calistoga. The room was large, comfortable, clean, had pleasing colors/decor with comfortable upholstered/padded bench at foot of bed. Many details - space in which to place luggage for easy access (both in room and bathroom), radio with easy-to see clock and iPod hookup - excellent coffee, ceramic coffee mugs (NO styrafoam!!), bar sink, microwave and refrigerator - all appreciated. Breakfast - one of the best Continental Breakfasts - clean, well supplied. Employees extremely courteous and helpful. Hotel layout attractive - the area quiet. Nice patio area with a few tables and chairs. A very enjoyable experience!!! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: Valerie B
Reviews.Content: We traveled through Napa Valley on Easter Sunday so wasn't sure what kind of accommodations we would find on that date. We actually called ahead and booked based on AAA tour book information. We received great customer service over the phone booking our room. When we arrived, our check in was quick. I had asked on the phone if they had laundry facilities and was told "yes". Our room was large, clean, with a view of the pool. We were located just steps from the laundry room, which made that task easier. The complimentary breakfast was great and got our day started off well. We would definitely stay here again and have already recommended this hotel to friends. Our Calistoga experience was wonderful - a big thanks to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Ellen951
Reviews.Content: Made what we thought would be a safe but boring choice staying at a Best Westen when choosing accomodations in Calistoga. How delightful to find updated and clean rooms, pool and hot tub usable and heated, coffee delicious and James at the front desk very friendly and helpful. Conveniently located, short walk to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “5:49 am wake-up "call"”
Reviews.Author: Notourhome
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at this hotel. I came on the recommendation of coworkers. The room was very clean and even had special sanitary covers on the tv remote which I have not seen at other hotels. Room Ammenities were great and the room was well appointed. My only criticism involves sound from the room next door. After staying up late to complete a project, I was frustrated to be woken up at 5:49 with talking from the room next door. My neighbor was taking a business call and I could understand him word for word and could not go back to sleep. My room had the locked door between the adjoining room next door so maybe that caused the poor soundproofing but I have not noticed this issue in similar rooms at other hotels. Unfortunately, this tainted what was otherwise a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Winedinetravel
Reviews.Content: My friend and I chose this hotel because we needed a room with two beds on the first floor. Have stayed at B and B's in the area at twice the price, so I was happily surprised to find a very spacious, comfortable room, totally updated, including the big screen tv and a complete wetbar with microwave, sink, coffeemaker with good coffee and a fridge with a turn off switch, very thoughtful and very reasonably priced Large bathroom with a seperate shower and a whirlpool tub, nice amenities, all superclean. The inn also has a pool, hot tub, sauna. The expanded continental breakfast was plentiful and delicious with fresh waffles every morning. The only thing that topped of all the comforts was the staff, from the friendly young man at check in time to Sandra, the Manager who buzzes around all morning and day to make sure everybody's wishes are attended to. The owners of this inn have made this a most charming property and I congratulate them on their hiring great staff. The location is perfect, right next door to the Indian Springs Spa, (although you can get spa treatments at he sister property down the street a a much better price) and only a short drive to either the towns in Napa Valley or Sonoma Valley. Only one suggestion, I would be happy to pay $10.00 more per night and have a bathrobe in the room, despite I look forward to returning soon!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Cocosun
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend here and were very impressed. The rooms were quite spacious and very clean. They also had a fridge and microwave, which was very helpful. The Inn is a little outside the small downtown of Calistoga, but you could walk there in 10 minutes. It's very quiet, which we like as light sleepers. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hands Down Best Value for Dollar in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Doglington
Reviews.Content: Calistoga is a great town as a base for exploring Wine Country. But your lodging choices here are mostly very expensive boutique spas. But what if you are on a budget, or have kids, or don't need 24/7 spa access? Well, then there is the Best Western Stevenson Manor. I'm giving it Five Stars because it is hands-down THE BEST VALUE FOR MONEY at this end of the Wine Country. However a good price is only an advantage if it doesn't mean substandard. At the Stevenson, you get scrupulously clean and spacious rooms -- a few with fireplaces -- and lots of amenities that add up to way more than you'd expect for the cost (which is well below $100 a night, especially with the many discounts offered: 2 or 3 night stay discount, AARP, AAA, Military. They even offer a discount for guest who are staying to be near relatives having operations at nearby St. Helena Hospital.) First of all, some of the pictures of the exterior make the place look bigger than it is. Rather than a big impersonal chain hotel, this is a cozy little motel -- only part of which is two story -- built around a charming little enclosed patio. The location is an easy walk to all the restaurants and spas along Calistoga's main drag. Let's go over what I got for my room rate of $89 (return visit discount for a Thursday and Friday night stay): *A large, scrupulously clean room with two double beds with comfortable linens and a lovely bathroom with whirlpool tub. (Some rooms have fire places and several are handicapped accessible.) *Lots of amenities such as free newspapers, Wi-Fi, sink, microwave, refrigerator, wine glasses, coffee service in room and more. *An amazingly good FREE breakfast that included my choice of waffles, yogurt and fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, toast, pastries, fresh juice. *Afternoon complimentary wine tasting with the day's featured wine and cheese. *Extremely friendly, attentive staff -- from the owner/manager who acted as a gracious host to the guy who quickly fixed a minor problem with our TV. This hotel would be especially good for families with children -- especially since kids are not usually welcomed at some of the more boutiquey inns around here. If you were trying to do the area on a budget or with a family, the free breakfasts alone would make it doable. (Load the kids up at breakfast, then stock your in-room fridge with snacks and sandwich fixins from the nearby Cala Market.) It's also a great budget option for exploring Wine Country. Most people flock to overpriced, overcrowded St. Helena. But Calistoga is right at the tip of the two main wine trails through the Valley -- Route 29 and the Silverado Trail. Calistoga also features some nice little museums such as The Sharpsteen Museum and access to mountain hiking, the Petrified Forest and the Old Faithful Geyser. Here are the things to be aware of about the Stephenson: *The hotel has a very nice little heated pool area with pool, hot tub, sauna. Yes, it is small, but almost all of the resorts around here have day passes or free pool access if you book a spa treatment. So use the Stephenson pool most days and book a spa treatment/pool day somewhere else for a splurge. *This is not necessarily a spot for a romantic getaway. While not as noisy as one reviewer claimed, people with children do stay here. As noted in other reviews, there are some rooms that are further removed from common areas. If quiet is important to you, ask for those rooms. So my recommendations? Families with kids or people on a budget, this is your place. AS for me? I don't have kids and I'm not on a budget, but I'm still glad I discovered the Stephenson. I was here twice while my mother had a knee replacement at St. Helena Hospital -- so I wasn't here for a vacation. But I found my experience enjoyable and comfortable. The bonus was, I felt comfortable splurging on a massage and good dinners at some of the town's best restaurants since my stay at the Stephenson was so reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelGirl36
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Napa for the $! Room was clean and staff was very courteous. Breakfast was good and filling. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience, great value.”
Reviews.Author: MarafromToronto
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on a recent trip to California, and one night in wine country. I had done a lot of research, and settled on this property because it looked like it delivered a lot of quality for the money. It was absolutely fantastic! Our king fireplace room was perfect, very up-to-date, and comfortable. The pool and hot tub were spotless, and at ideal temps. The continental breakfast was extensive. We walked into town in just a few minutes.The staff were helpful and welcoming. All around, we would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel to See Napa”
Reviews.Author: BroncoJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Stevenson Manor for my first trip to Napa. The rates were fairly good. It is very comfortable and close to the Silverado Trail to allow the easiest and quickest way to travel up and down the Napa Valley. It is a long way from Napa at the opposite end of the valley, but it is still accessible to everything very easily. Calistoga is a bit more laid back, too Calistoga is a nice town and we took a couple of walks around to see everything there. It is very close to the famous Chateau Montelena of "Bottle Shock" fame, from which the first Napa wines to win in a head to head blind competition against French wine in 1976 were bottled. It is also close to the Napa Old Faithful Geyser and has some beautiful scenery. I went about 1-2 miles west of the hotel along Grant toward Tubbs and ran up Bennett Lane, through the grapevines. Beautiful, beautiful area for a morning run. Very happy with the stay, the customer service, and the location.

Reviews.Title: “The fireplace suite, room 202”
Reviews.Author: ktorgers99
Reviews.Content: Our one night at in the fireplace suite was quite comfortable. Although the fireplace flame was match-like, the front desk folks referred to this as "ambient" and the engineer never called back on a Sunday night of a holiday weekend. The microwave was clean, but it didn't work. Or, I couldn't get it to work. However, the room was spacious and exceptionally clean and I appreciated seeing the remote in a "disinfected" bag. There's a mini fridge and glass wineglasses. The mineral pool spa is small but comfortable and much quieter than spas nearby. There's a pool but a little cold this time of year. Great breakfast, included hard boiled eggs, decent coffee, yogurt, kashi, choice of oatmeal, waffles, fresh fruit, bagels. Snack mix at night in the lobby. I'm going back to Calistoga next weekend and plan to tack on a second night at the Best Western Plus Stevenson Manor. Clean place; friendly folks at the front desk. ("sweet" says my husband.) I thought the stay was well worth it. About a quarter-mile past the "downtown" of Calistoga. Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and Customer Service in the Napa Valley!”
Reviews.Author: monalott
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to the Napa Valley region for the past 9 months for business and stayed at many local places. This is by far the Best!! You will get treated like family, by all the employees of the hotel. From the owners to the housekeeping staff. The hotel is well maintained and exceptionally clean. Within walking distance to local shops and restaurants. Pool and hot tub are open year round, which is wonderful on a clear starry night! There is plenty of room throughout, nice to have a fridge and microwave in your room. Many mornings you might wake up to hot air balloons being launched in the empty field near the mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to town”
Reviews.Author: j_nine13
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night here in between Christmas and New Years. We booked it at the last minute, not sure if you could do this at peak season as there aren't a lot of accommodations in the under $150 range in Calistoga. The view behind the hotel of the mountains was amazing and I had the view out my window. The employee upon check in was very polite and assisted us in getting reservations at some local restaurants. The rooms were very clean with a lot of extras. There was a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. 2 each of glasses, coffee mugs and even wine glasses (you are in wine country after all!). There was also a lot of things in the bathroom - plenty of towels, the standard shampoo and conditioner but also body wash, lotion, q-tips, cotton balls and makeup remover wipes. They also had a 'real' hair dryer as opposed to those on the wall kinds. You could definitely walk to some close by restaurants and even downtown Calistoga although that would have probably taken 15 - 20 minutes. Parking wasn't an issue in town for us but we were definitely there during the slower period. We ate at Jole while there, it was awesome. They had an expanded continental breakfast but I didn't get to check it out - or the pool/hot tub due to our short visit. The only complaint that I have was the bed. I had one queen in the room and the bed felt like anytime they had one person staying they put them in this room for the past 5 years and every single one of them slept right in the middle of the bed. I was very glad to only have to sleep in the bed for one night. Despite the great view I would have probably requested a different room if we were staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel”
Reviews.Author: Halo2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Stevenson Manor for 2 nights in December, and had rooms on the upper deck facing the field. The location is fantastic, which is really close to town with supermarket and fantastic restaurants. We only took about 3 mins to drive to town (didn't want to walk in the cold) :) Room was clean and huge with flat screen TV. The bathroom was also big with lots of vanity-top space for our toiletries and amenities. However I wish the bathroom has a heating system as my family had to resort to turning on the hot tap and let it run to heat up the room before taking our showers. Staff was very friendly, and provided good advice regarding which vineyard to visit for us with kids in tow. Breakfast selection, however, was really limited - with sourdough bread (not my favourite), cold hardboiled eggs, juices and coffee/teas. There was no hot food provided except for the waffles. Laundry service can be better as there's only one washer and dryer. Our 3 families had to take turns to do the washing either in the early morning or when we return. It's a pity we didn't see any hot air balloon taking off during our stay there. There is also a heated pool for us to use but we didn't use it. Overall it's quite a pleasant stay and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel close to heart of Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: NatLDN
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Thanksgiving (Nov 2011). We were very impressed with the size and standards of this hotel considering its â€˜budgetâ€™ status. The hotel is on the main Calistoga high street but 5-10 min walk from the main stretch of restaurants, bars and shops. You can walk into the centre of things in less than 10 min, although there is a small part of the walk that doesnâ€™t have a sidewalk/pavement. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were large, clean & well equipped. The rooms had a TV, small kitchenette with coffee machine (but no stove, so not suitable for cooking, but youâ€™d eat in town as youâ€™re so close), the bathroom was a moderate size but we were very impressed by the thoughtful touches like lovely soaps/shower gels, hair dryer, and make up remover wipes. The breakfast in the morning was a buffet style just off reception in a smallish space, but that too was great as it had lots of variety; as well as the standard, toast, cereal, fruit, there were bagels, a waffle maker and pastries. The hotel also has an outdoor pool although we didnâ€™t make use of it because it was November. There is a car park attached to the hotel. If we went again we would visit some of the famous Calistoga spas, but as it was Thanksgiving none were open. This is a great base from which to explore the Napa Valley. Youâ€™re also a 30 min drive from St. Helena which is a lovely pretty little town.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Janetm53
Reviews.Content: This motel was perfect for our needs. Great location, very clean and good pool. It was a 5 minute walk into Calistoga - grocery store and lots of restaurants. The room was quiet - we slept very well. Helped no doubt by 18 holes of golf and a swim each day! Service was fast and efficient both arriving and leaving. We stayed for three nights at the end of September 2011. We usually stay at the Napa end but have been staying at best westerns lately and been pleased with them so we decided to give the other end of the valley a try. The Silverado Trail - just as fast as the main highway but way less traffic - runs about a quarter mile behind the motel so the location was perfect for us. All golf courses were within a 45 minute drive and what a beautiful drive it is - through acres of vineyards and wineries. We will go back to this motel and I would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: OlympicWest
Reviews.Content: Stevenson Manor is a typical best western motel, not really a "manor". The rooms are in good shape, nicely furnished, but not anything elaborate or high-end. The pricing is good and the place provides quick access to Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Oakland_Gal
Reviews.Content: This motel is a few minutes' walk from the "main drag" in Calistoga, and though not a "luxury spa" like so many other places advertise, it is clean, offers plenty of parking, free hot breakfast, and very friendly staff. When we arrived early, they took our bags, while we went for a bike ride. The front desk staff, very friendly, offered to call us when the room was ready and to take our bags directly in. Both of these were done. The room was well-appointed, clean and had everything we needed (that higher-end places offer, like shampoo, hair dryer etc.). We got the AAA rate of $149 (I think) for a 2-queen room, which was about $100 cheaper than the other places we looked at. I would stay here again in a heart-beat and would recommend to anyone who wants a nice, clean no-frills place to stay. Save your money on the room, and spend it on a spa treatment, and at Jole' restaurant or any of the other delicious places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Escape Inflated prices in St Helena”
Reviews.Author: daisy281
Reviews.Content: You may want to eat in one of the high priced restaurants in St Helena or Yountville without paying the inflated prices to stay there.If so, drive 10 minutes north and stay in Calistoga at the Stevenson Manor. Everything about the place is just fine:the rooms are nice, ,the place is quiet(.Except for the noisy heater/AC which seems to be a problem in all Best Westerns) The breakfast was unusually good in that the fresh fruit salad contained rasberrys and blueberrys and skim milk was available.The motel is a short walk to downtown. Not cheap,but more reasonable than most places in this high priced area

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: TravelOn11
Reviews.Content: Stayed two wonderful nights here. The room was very clean, updated and spacious. Breakfast was very nice as well with good coffee and belgian waffles. Small, quiet pool area was perfect for a break on a hot August afternoon. Friendly and accomodating staff. The hotel is just outside Calistoga and only a short walk into town. A great place to start our day exploring the Napa Valley. Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: mexicoamigo
Reviews.Content: This property is our choice when staying in Calistoga. Any problems,, just see Albiono or Sandra. Popular spot, so don't pull in at 6PM without a res.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelGirl36
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Napa for the $! Room was clean and staff was very courteous. Breakfast was good and filling. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Close to the best”
Reviews.Author: dindan
Reviews.Content: We had two nights here at Stevenson Manor, it wasn't long enough. The Hotel is on the Edge of Calistoga but it was only a short walk into town. Calistoga itself is lovely. The rear of our room overlooked the very nice pool area, the entrance to the room was from an attractive enclosed courtyard. The room was nicely decorated with good furniture. As we were travelling with our 13 year old son we went for the twin double bed room, the beds felt a little small. There was only the pool between us and the road but we heard no road noise.The reception staff were informative and friendly. The breakfast was ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon hotel - Stop 2”
Reviews.Author: Fats25
Reviews.Content: Firstly on enquiry at the hotel to arrange the booking, every person I spoke to was very courteous, and gave the information we were looking for. We booked the massage package through this hotel - although the massage was actually held at another hotel (EuroSpa), and the only issue we had was confirming the massage (due to timezone) as I was leaving work before they opened for the day. However this was all sorted before we left the UK. Firstly the room was very large, clean, and secure, with plenty of amenities. The pool area was quite small, but perfect for the number of guest rooms there, and again was clean, with towels available etc. The continental breakfast was exactly what we wanted, to set us up for our day ahead, and we were easily impressed by the waffle machine! The only downside to hotel (and this is minor) was that it is right at the end of the main street in Calistoga, and so you have probably the most amount of walking to do as possible in the town. It is not a large street so is no issue, but when walking back late at night there are no street lights at this end of town, so would recommend taking a torch for your walk back if you want a drink........... Overall a great hotel and would stay here again.......

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CulinaryGoddess
Reviews.Content: The best hotel that we stayed at in our 8 days on the road traveling the West Coast. The decor is beautiful with fantastic black and white photos on the wall. I especially liked the one of the vineyard. The bed was huge and comfortable. The "kitchen" area had a microwave and mini fridge and surprise, surprise real glasses and mugs. The bathroom was large and spacious. The "courtyard" was nicely landscaped and was a nice place to eat our continental breakfast. The continental breakfast was about average. Muffins, bagels, coffee, hard boiled eggs and fruit salad. Nice hot tub and salt water pool. They even have a small stacked washer/dryer in the area with the vending machine. Too bad the vending machine didn't sell soap and fabric softener. I might have thrown a load or two in while I was in the pool. Location was walkable to the "downtown" area. Nice boutiques and restaurants. We ate at JoLe and had a fabulous meal. Quite memorable with the wine pairing. I would have to say for what we paid for this hotel compared to other hotels in the Napa area it far exceeded my expectations. I would certainly stay again if I was in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Northern Napa County”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler1217
Reviews.Content: I am probably one of the few people who has stayed here for business, but I did have the pleasure of working in Napa County recently. This hotel is everything that all the other reviewers have said. I had a very nice, large, King -bed room with a view of the mountains. I, too, was thrilled to see the hot air balloons launching right outside my room! The bathroom was very clean, which is important to me. The only "cons" I would note: the walls are very thin, and I could hear the people in the room next to me. Also, I don't normally like to stay in hotels that have "motel style" entrances. This one does (has kind of an apartment complex feel to it), but Calistoga is so safe, I really didn't mind. I would definitely stay here again and I truly think it is one of the best deals around!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: Had a 2nd floor King room with fireplace and mountain view. Our room had a very nice view of the John Deere dealership between us and the mountains. Not complaining, though, as hotels can't control what is built around them, and other rooms probably didn't have as prominent a view of the dealership. Got too see hot air balloons launched from the field next door! That was a treat. Room was very nice and recently renovated. Felt like we were in a 5-star hotel - fancy stuff in bathroom. Been in nice Best Western's, but this exceeded expectations. Staff was very nice. Complimentary breakfast was good. Staying in Calistoga was very nice. Small town feel, but plenty of good places to eat. No matter where you're staying in the valley, you have to drive to the different wineries and restaurants, so would definitely stay in Calistoga again. Admittedly, if you want to spend much of your time in Napa town, then Calistoga may not be so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VivSpa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights based on trip advisor reviews and it exceeded our expectations. We had a beautiful king size room with fireplace and mountain view plus a nice breakfast with lots of fresh fruit. There's a pool and hot tub plus a beautiful courtyard where we ate our take out dinner with a bottle of wine each night. There's a super fast computer in the lobby which I used to check emails. The entire hotel was spotless and the staff exceptionally friendly and accommodating. This is an exceptional value and I would recommend it in a heartbeat to anyone. Also, it's about a 5 min walk into town which makes for a nice stroll before or after dinner without having to worry about drinking and driving.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: robertoed
Reviews.Content: Stopped at this hotel on the way down from WA to San Francisco. Hotel located in a quiet part of town, yet close to the main street area. The room was large and very clean and modern. Cost-wise, not as expensive as other hotels in this part of Napa Valley, but not inexpensive either. Breakfast was included and it had by far the best selection available of all of the hotels we stayed at during the trip. Would certainly consider this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Calistoga Stay at A Great Calistoga Property"”
Reviews.Author: bluesramsrock
Reviews.Content: Our expecatations were high for this this property based on he nunerous great TA reviews. I have to say they were exceeded. Everything about this property is right. From the excellent staff, the comfortable and nicely appointed rooms to the excellently designed and maintained grounds. The staff has great knowledge of the area and are willing to share their inisghts. Breakfast was very good and the walking distance to the town is perfect. We loved our stay in Calistoga and that was in large part because of the great experience the Stevenson Manor provided. You can pay $900 a night to sleep in Calistoga. I have no idea why you would want to do that with the Stevenson Manor being such a great much less expensive option!

Reviews.Title: “clean”
Reviews.Author: jkuryak
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute on a saturday night. Nothing fancy, but room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Karen1423
Reviews.Content: All I ask for in a hotel is quiet and clean... to get excellent service, perfect location and extra amenities like a delicious breakfast (beyond continental) is a plus! And this Best Western is a PLUS! It makes me want to revisit the whole "4-star only" mentality I had regarding a nice stay. Quite frankly, when you add on parking fees, hidden costs and expensive food, which many of the 4-stars include, this was a deal! No frills, valets or nightclubs... just everything WE needed for a very nice, quiet, relaxing stay after a fun day of wine-tasting.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: AZGUY99
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for 2 nights in July and had an awesome time. The staff is extremely friendly, breakfast was great and the hotel is walking distance to spas, shops and all the action in Calistoga. We can't wait to go back for another visit. Thanks Best Western!

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean and worked for us”
Reviews.Author: ocean35
Reviews.Content: A better than usual BW. Nothing fancy, but good room. Ask for a room away from the street, which is really busy. Small pool, and there was construction going on. Breakfast is not as good as at other BWs, but does the job. Probably would stay at something a bit nicer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: BOJ_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and 9-year-old daughter - much more reasonable than area hotels, very clean, friendly staff, comfortable beds, quiet crowd, crystal clear pool (and a few retirees on the deck rather than a swarm of children), good breakfast with fresh fruit. We mentioned that it was an anniversary when we made the reservation, and the manager prepared a creative "wedding cake" made of towels, with a bottle of wine and a nice card that was waiting for us when we entered the room. With what we saved on the rate, we covered most of my wife's spa cost in town. If we visit Calistoga again, we'll stay here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, and a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ElectronEYE
Reviews.Content: Usually opting for other hotel chains, my parents convinced us to stay with them at the Best Western Stevenson Manor in Calistoga. Upon check-in, the staff was courteous and prompt with getting us to our rooms. We didn't have any issues with the rates as my parents were AARP and my wife and I, AAA. We booked 3 weeks prior to arrival and received a great rate. When I checked back online the week before our schedule stay, the hotel had already sold out. Early booking is recommended as the value for the stay is worth it. The rooms are clean and spacious with a refrigerator and small kitchenette (sink, microwave, coffee, maker). Breakfast is presented well and the standard American breakfast spread at most other hotels. The staff is very attentive to replenishing any yogurts, bread, or juice selections that may run low or out at the buffet during the morning rush. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Best Western and will consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: Travelsbycar
Reviews.Content: Staying in Wine Country can be an expensive proposition, so I was delighted to find a place that didn't cost hundreds of dollars a night! The rooms in this Best Western in Calistoga CA were very large, beautiful and most of all spotless. The added (and unexpected treat) was the large jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. There is a lovely center court out doors that was perfect for breakfast, an afternoon cup of coffee or a nice glass of wine in the evening. The pool and hot tub were also very nice. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel was located on the outskirts of Calistoga and was very quiet. A place I will definately return to!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: gerryb18
Reviews.Content: This small hotel, goes way beyond the typical Best Western. The rooms are very large. The service is excellent. The location is within walking distance to downtown Calistoga, and a short drive to most wineres. Also close to "Old Faithful" and the Petrified Forrest. Good value for the area, which is quite pricey!

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Lovemyiphone
Reviews.Content: We needed a one night stay on a Friday night and most of the fancier places require a two-night stay so we chose the BW Stevenson Manor. What a great surprise when we opened the door! Rooms were beautiful like a higher-end boutique hotel, but with mini-bar type set-up in the room with additional sink, microwave, fridge and coffee pot -- the Peerless coffee offered by the hotel for the room was great, by the way. The bathroom was HUGE, too if that is a requirement. There was a gorgeous pool with spa that we did not use. Our room faced that and would have been noisy had we not kept on the a/c. It was a hot day so that wasn't a problem. TV also had tons of cable channels including Versus so we were able to see the end of the Tour de France from our room. Breakfast was also included in the price, just continental but good enough to get you on the road. Wi-fi included in price, too. It is close enough to town of Calistoga if you want to walk in, although we had dinner plans at a winery so didn't do that. We always go to Napa for our anniversary and definitely intend to use this hotel on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ginny123
Reviews.Content: We chose the Best Western for its value but were pleasantly surprised by both the conditions of the hotel and its proximity to downtown. Room was very clean and tastefully decorated. Included refrigerator and microwave. Front office staff was quite pleasant and helpful. Had a pool, jacuzzi, sauna and steam room. The hotel is right on the edge of the Calistoga business district (near the Silverado Trail) but is an easy walk to the heart of town.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise.....loved every minute of it !!”
Reviews.Author: ninernut
Reviews.Content: Time to get out of the house for a road trip, with kids (aged 10 and 11) getting antsy on school holiday. Hadnâ€™t been to wine country for a few years, due to a number of reasons, and thought kids were old enough now to appreciate it. Reading other gushing reviews, I was a little skeptical that this place was this good for relatively little money. After having spent a night there, I will chime in and give a second to all previous commentary about the Stevenson. I would really have to nit pick to find something wrong with this motel, and the overall experience. Where to begin? Pleasant reception; helpful and friendly staff; clean, well-maintained room; mini-kitchen with whole bean coffee!!; whirlpool bathtub; pool view; complimentary internet; iPod dock. On the outside, heated pool and hot tub, ample parking lot, pleasant courtyard-sitting area to enjoy a glass of Napa Valley wine. We would have preferred a queen bed instead of a double, but not a big deal. A continental breakfast is advertised. Usually that means a stale cinnamon roll and coffee. Not here. Fresh waffles, hard-boiled eggs, coffee, cereal, fruit, toasted bagels, muffins or bread, muffins, orange juice, etc. Breakfast room can get busy around 8:30, so go earlier or later, maybe. If it is SRO, there is another dining room adjacent to the office, or enjoy the courtyard. The property is located at the east end of the main street and is away from the CBD, but a very pleasant, short walk into town. If it is essential for you to be right at center stage, front row, then the Stevenson may not be for you. The location, however, was a positive for us. Calistoga is the perfect base to visit both the Napa Valley and Sonoma wineries, and seems like a thousand miles away from the gridlock that has become St. Helena. Really, for the mid $100.00 range, for a quality wine country lodging, in season, this place is a bargain. Guaranteed, we will stay at the Stevenson again when visit the Napa Valley. Oh, a note on visiting local wineries. As I said, itâ€™s been a while since our last visit. Nothing is gratis here, any longer. Most if not all charge for tasting. And, most do not have a â€˜no appointmentâ€™ winery-only tour. If they offer a guided tour at all, you will have the pleasure of forking out $20.00, minimum. One winery wanted $17.50 per person for the self-guided tour, with no tasting!! Charge for tasting maybe, but for the tour with no tasting, I find particularly galling.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great base for Napa and Sonoma Valleys”
Reviews.Author: GioVale20
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in July 2011. The hotel is located just outside the village of Calistoga, where you can find excellent restaurants and nice shops. The location is ideal for both Napa and Sonoma Valleys. Napa itself is about 30 minutes away and you can reach both Healdsburg and Santa Rosa (Sonoma) in the same amount of time. We received a angled room on the upper floor. Although the room was next to the service room, it was very quiet and thanks to the angled position we had windows on both sides of the room. Furthermore, the room was very clean and the amenities offered were better than at other BW we stayed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We absolutely suggest Stevenson Manor as a base for visiting the Wine Country.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Northern Napa Valley visit”
Reviews.Author: scs8918
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a visit to Napa Valley. Rooms are good sized, very clean and well maintained. Hotel is a short walk to town centre with abundance of restaurants, useful so that driver could sample some of the local produce after a day of sniffing and very small sips! Good variety breakfast provided. Only downside some of my wife's cosmetics went missing. No great value but annoying

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hanae54
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The staff was polite. The room was spotless and comfortable.. Our room faced the street and we never heard a sound for the morning traffic. Neither did we hear our neighbours next door. Delicious breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Woops forgot to tell us....”
Reviews.Author: cdean4760
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we saw a flyer taped to the check in counter saying basically, please be aware of the Sprint Car races on the eves of May 29th & 30th from 7:00pm to 11:00pm. It may be loud!! Well it sounded like they were racing around the motel for 4 hours!!! When we finally got to sleep, we were awakened at 6:00am to a screaming baby that just kept crying. Walls were paper thin. Got downstairs to breakfast and there were not enough places to sit. On the flip side, the room was nice and the bed was cozy. Way over priced for what you get!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Room”
Reviews.Author: MariaT16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is equipped with elegant bed and furniture. We enjoyed the jacuzzi and the steam room to ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: ajolissant
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to the wine country and I am very glad we choose Calistoga as the location. Such a beautiful area! Calistoga is a small town, but it's close to a lot of wineries. The Best Western Stevenson Manor was a great choice for us! Great location! We have a great view from our room facing the hill. It was very relaxing and quiet sitting out on our patio drinking a glass a wine. The hotel is walking distance to the little town. The hotel room was nice and not your typical road side Best Western. I loved the breakfast, waffles, fruit, cereal, boiled eggs, coffee, and juice. Staff was friendly. Free parking and free internet! Couldn't have asked for more! I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: msa1164
Reviews.Content: What more can be said? I just hope it doesn't change! Rooms are large and exceptionally clean. We love the Calistoga location - quiet yet close to restaurants and wineries. Second floor rooms have fireplace but you will need to carry luggage up some steps. Immaculate, function bathroom and plenty of parking. Front desk clerk (Sandy?) was extermely nice and personable. Always priced right. We've enjoyed staying here for our yearly visit to Napa Valley. Please dont change a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great northern wine country hotel.”
Reviews.Author: minx1290
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with high quality rooms. Despite the name best western, there is nothing remotely best western sounding about this hotel. Many rooms have fire places or balconies and are extremely spacious and comfortable. The hotel is located in Calistoga, CA which is on the upper end of Napa wine country and just a beautiful mountain road drive over to Sonoma County. The town itself is extremely compact and many restaurants and shopping are within walking distance of this hotel. The staff is extrememly accomodating and friendly. Have stayed here many times before and will always be out hotel of preference on our semi-annual Napa vally trips.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, clean, great in every way for our getaway.”
Reviews.Author: osueana
Reviews.Content: Great customer service and clean, large rooms. Breakfast was efficient and had make-your-own Belgian waffles! Fresh fruit, cut up with yogurt, regular fruit, cereal and milk, pastries. It was enough to keep you until lunch for sure. Beds were very comfortable and they have free wi-fi and computer in the lobby to use if you simply must check your email. I would recommend this place highly. Idid not get to the pool and spa area, but they looked inviting. It was the best stay I've had in long time. Thanks to Sandy & Stevenson Manor Inn in Calistoga! I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LawyerMotherOfTwins
Reviews.Content: I stay here often when visiting Napa. The rooms were remodeled a few years ago. They are modern and ultra clean. The bedding is very nice. The staff is always friendly, helpful and competent. The breakfast options improved since my last visit. They now offer hard-boiled eggs, fresh fruit and freshly made waffles. They also have in-room kitchenettes, includng, coffee makers with a built-in grinder. They supply whole beans. They have free wi-fi and a lovely courtyard with patio tables/chairs for picnics or dining al fresco.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for average price”
Reviews.Author: GoNext
Reviews.Content: For a short stay, 2 nights/3 days, this hotel is fine at the average price . The king balcony room is updated and well maintained with all the standard amenties. The hotel serves quality continental breakfast (boiled eggs, waffles, bagels, juices, coffee, mixed fruit). The bed is comfortable, the bedsheets and towels appear clean. But the pillows aren't firm and they feel hallow. We sleep without the pillows that did not work for our neck/back. So bring your own pillows. We like the no-smoking policy and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable at best.”
Reviews.Author: destinationchange
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location within walking distance to Calistoga. However, the new renovated rooms were average at best. The shower was poor plumbing with limited water pressure and a broken nozzle that basically shot in every direction. The mattress on the bed was so uncomfortable we stayed awake the majority of the night trying to find a comfortable sleeping position without feeling the springs from the mattress. The hotel was almost empty and we were placed in a room under another occupied room, the walls were so thin we could hear their entire conversations and their loud noises at 4:30 in the morning. To top it all off, they turned the hot water off and notified us by placing a typed paper on the bathroom mirror while we were out for the day. So unprofessional and such a horrible experience. Needless to say we checked out early to find a more comfortable option with running hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, comfortable and convenient motel.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy0726
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends whiile visiting the Napa Valley Wine country. The staff was very helpful starting with making our reservations and following through with their advice and recommendations. The rooms were clean, comfortable beds, and spacious. The complimentary breakfast was very good with plenty of choices. The location was quiet, yet convenient to attractions. I would recommend this to other travelers to the valley

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: TahoeTravelers
Reviews.Content: We set out for a different destination, and ended up in Calistoga. The people at the Stevenson Manor Inn took good care of us. We had a room overlooking the meadow and hills, with a small balcony. It was a room away from the highway, so it was pretty quiet. The room looked recently updated. And, with AAA, it was less than $100! Perfect for our last minute getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: beachlover997
Reviews.Content: We were unable to book rooms at the Mt. View for one night only on the weekend, so we stayed at Stevenson Manor which also offered us three king rooms. Rooms were very large, bathrooms were huge, and everything has been newly updated/decorated. Breakfast is included and it was simple but filling and offered fresh fruit, cereals waffles, and muffins/breads. Walking distance to town, it is well located for wine tasting in the Calistoga area. We walked from our lodging to a morning hike Sunday up in the hills on teh east side of the valley. I'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for Wine Country Weekend”
Reviews.Author: terriam
Reviews.Content: We came to Calistoga for a NYE ball and Stevenson Inn was recommended by the winery (Castello di Amorosa). This was a great value, the room was very clean, the linens and furnishings seemed new. The breakfast choices were plentiful (great waffles!) and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I agree with other reviewers, this was far more than I expected for a 'Best Western Motel'.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room away from the Road - or you will feel like cars are going thru the bedroom.”
Reviews.Author: perkinswi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK - we would Rate it just Average. Rooms are clean. Walls are thin - heard the guy in the next room snoring all night. We had a balcony room - with a great view of the traffic on the 2 lane road right under our feet. We did enjoy the free breakfast, nice selection. We also used the hot tub and steam room. both clean - but right on the road, so not really relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced Calistoga motel”
Reviews.Author: CalifWilma
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our getaway to Calistoga and Stevenson Manor is a fine place to stay. It's not as charming as Indian Springs, but much cheaper! We were assigned a fireplace 2nd floor room overlooking the pool. We got a bit of road noise. It was pouring rain so the fireplace was fun. As others have noted the breakfast room gets overcrowded when the weather is bad. The free breakfast was pretty good, lots of fresh fruit and the waffle machine was great. Because it gets crowded the hotel should implement a no cell phone policy in the breakfast room, both mornings inconsiderate guests were yelling into their phones. We walked over to Indian Springs for the spa and pool, very convenient. We dined at Jole and Solbar, both within walking distance and great restaurants! Upon checkout we were given coupons to return at $89/night Nov-March, great deal. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise! Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: AvocadoSF
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at Indian Springs or the Mountview Hotel - they were booked, so this was our first time at the BW. It was very clean, modern and a good sized King room with pull-out couch. Location was great, too - quieter side of Calistoga, so we biked to Solage for lunch. They have a small pool on the premises and breakfast (bagels, waffles, cereal). Some other hotels in Calistoga have the older, funky bathroom, so it was nice to have a modern bathroom setup. Would definitely stay here again, and it's great with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: bushnell123
Reviews.Content: I expected a big, impersonal Best Western, but this turned out to be a very cozy, small hotel with a pretty courtyard and a nice quiet location. We asked for a room facing the meadow and had a lovely surprise when two hot air balloons took off from it one morning. The rooms are pleasant, the staff is attentive and having the breakfast in the courtyard is a bonus. We had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: mfmorgan
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, although on the road side of the hotel, so some traffic noise. Air conditioning unit very noisy....so awake with air-con on, or awake with window open. Breakfast a disappointment. I do not expect disposable plates, dishes etc in a Best Western....the courtyard was very good to eat in due to the glorious weather. However the breakfast room is very small and cramped if we had needed to use it. Pool area good, esp the hot-tub. As I have already stated, the breakfast was the only down side....maybe they should invest in proper crockery!!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: KansasHummingbird
Reviews.Content: This BW was OK, but I wish I had looked into bed & breakfasts for the same price. The room was large, comfortable, and quiet, so I really have no complaints there. The breakfast was adequate, but not up to the standards of other hotels in this caliber. Toast, boiled eggs, fruit, waffles -- I just expected more variety. The breakfast area was VERY small, and it was too cool to eat in the courtyard. As I said in the beginning, this hotel, for one night, was alright, but I would look for other accommodations next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Calistoga/St. Helena wedding (and reasonable!)”
Reviews.Author: dka05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked last minute at the Stevenson Manor Inn to attend a wedding just out of town. It turned out to be perfectly located and also walking distance to town. The room was really well done and comfortable, and the staff was great and helped us find our way around. The rate was also very reasonable, especially considering it was a wedding season weekend in Napa! Will definitely be back for the next one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: antrec
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was very nice. It was close to the main area. The rooms were roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Family Wedding Group”
Reviews.Author: higgins08
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our son's weddding in Calistoga,CA . The entrie wedding group of family and friends stayed at the Inn. Our rooms were great, and the center courtyard was perfect for our evening family get-togethers. What a perfect location for a family reunion. The breakfast was more than adequate. Lots of fresh fruit and great waffles. After a late dinning at one of Calistoga's great restaurants, all we needed was a light breatfast. There was usually coffee and fruit available throughout the day. The staff (Sandy) was super. She remembered everyone's name and greeted you warmly. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Overall, but Lousy Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pedrosd
Reviews.Content: As mentioned by many reviewers, Sevenson Manor Inn provides great value in the Napa Valley area. Large, clean, comfortable rooms, excellent location, good pool/jacuzzi. It is an old school motel layout, but done very well. We were disappointed in the breakfast. We didn't have expectations beyond what one would normally receive at a complimentary continental breakfast buffet - and this was lousy - poor limited choices, unappetizing, cramped room. Stay at the Stevenson Manor Inn, but go out to breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!! Loved Calistoga!”
Reviews.Author: geo54
Reviews.Content: The Stevenson Manor Inn is a great place to stay in Calistoga. The rooms are huge!! There is a sink, microwave and fridge in the room. Bathroom is very spacious as well. Comfortable bed and the tv had lots of great channels. Our balcony was on the smaller side than expected, but had two chairs and a little table that overlooked vineyards and the hills. On the grounds there is a pool (sunny), hot tub, wet sauna and dry sauna open till 10pm. Breakfast was okay with a waffle maker, cut up fruit, boiled eggs, juice, coffee, toast, bagels and cereal from 7-10am. The people working the front desk are extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is walking distance to many things around town. Maybe a 10 min walk to the center of town with restaurants, stores and markets. We also walked to Golden Haven for a mud bath. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Calistoga. I know that we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: SherburnLil
Reviews.Content: Had two nights at this hotel and would highly recommend it. The reception was helpful and friendly. The room spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was more than adequate and had a good choice, we ate ours outside in the courtyard which was nice but can imagine that it does get crowded inside if the weather is poor. The pool area was clean and relaxing and a decent size to have a swim. It's in a good location about 5 to 10 minutes walk into town. Calistogo is a really nice town with some lovely restaurants and a good micro brewery pub!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, excellent value & location”
Reviews.Author: Southwards
Reviews.Content: Following reviews on Trip Advisor, we stayed here for 3 nights while touring Napa Valley. The room was comfortable, well-equipped and quiet with a good bathroom and fast wi-fi. The hotel location is excellent, just a few minutes walk from the bars & restaurants of Calistoga and well-positioned for an easy drive to anywhere in the Napa Valley. Despite this, the rates are very reasonable for the area and the hotel is very good value. We had a minor electrical fault in our room but it was fixed quickly and efficiently, while the service overall was very good with friendly, helpful staff. The only disappointment was the breakfast which was a bit spartan with only limited seating inside. Overall, a good hotel and we'll certainly stay here again next time we're in Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaCop
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and wish I had stayed a 2nd night instead of moving on to a hotel in Napa. I had a King room with a balcony and the room was excellent. It was very spacious, well appointed, had a comfortable bed and the bathroom was well done. Breakfast was a fairly typical continental breakfast with good coffee. It was cool out but as advertised the pool was heated and comfortable to swim in. There is also a nice courtyard in the middle of the hotel which has tables and chairs for breakfast or other dining. I can't imagine what the other hotels in the Calistoga area could offer to justify an extra $200-500 a night. I'd rather spend the extra money on some good wine and perhaps visit the market just down the street, then have a nice picnic meal in the courtyard here. Be clear this is not a full service hotel; if that's what you are looking for go elsewhere. They have a sign indicating there is no staff on site after 11 pm. If you are here to relax and see the Napa Valley, visit wineries and explore on your own, this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Calistoga Area between 2 wine trails”
Reviews.Author: travelerlpl
Reviews.Content: This is a Best Western Hotel located betwen Hwy 29 and the Silverado Trail. Walking distance to Calistoga Restaurants and Spas. Right now they are remodeling, however didn't seem to be a problem with any noise since we were only there during the evening hours and early a.m. Has a little courtyard if you would like to sit outside for your complimentary breakfast. It includes waffles, fresh fruit w/yogurt, bagels, muffins, english muffins, cereal, waffles, hard boiled eggs and coffee/tea/OJ. The room was a nice size and had a nice 32 inch plasma tv, however, the remote was hard to use. Also included was a coffee maker, micro, fridge and wet bar. Swimming pool, hot tub, steam and sauna also. Nice hotel with not alot of frills or fluff, but very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: scubasteve99
Reviews.Content: wife and i brought our 1 yr old with us on a trip to san francisco that included a night in calistoga - was a little skeptical that a best western would be such a nice hotel, but after a good experience at the best western grand saint michel in paris we made our reservation - called the hotel and booked a ground floor room and a crib - all was ready when we arrived, extremely helpful attendant at checkin also had some good dinner recommendations. complimentary continental breakfast with waffles was a nice treat. free wifi worked perfectly the first time we tried to connect the blackberry. very spacious room and an excellent mattress. we would not hesitate to stay here again if we were in the area - it was a very comfortable home base for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great!”
Reviews.Author: HL950
Reviews.Content: We were looking to stay in Napa Valley for a single weekend night, and most of the hotels we desired had a minimum stay of 2 nights. Understandable, but annoying, if you want to stay in a nice-ish hotel. I literally felt lucky to book this hotel, as it was the LAST hotel, I swear, for that weekend in Napa. Truthfully? This is a great little placel. I don't think there is a single thing to complain about. Of course, it's priced high for what it is; I think in a fairer market it should be about $50 less/night, but unless you want to stay in Santa Rosa, you won't find those prices in Calistoga. Wonderful, wonderful location - walkable to downtown Calistoga. Easy access to Silverado Trail and the highway. Recently redone/remodeled and very nice styling. The hotel feels very new and clean and impeccable. Extremely updated and chic inside. We stayed in a corner room (217), and our view of the vineyards was actually pretty dreamy when we woke up the next morning. Who would have thought? I didn't even miss not staying at Solage, like I thought I would!

Reviews.Title: “The smile makes the final touch”
Reviews.Author: mmmel83
Reviews.Content: My review may seem outdated, I stayed last summer in this hotel but I still want to share my pleasure to have a smiling receptionist welcoming me with a warm "Hi, how are you doing?" every time I stepped in the lobby. The hotel is comfortable, clean, good in all points. I had a bit of bad luck with my toilets being broken but it was fixed efficiently by the night receptionist (absolutely perfect, professional and efficient over the phone. A lovely person who did her best despite my bad english). She sent a housekeeper to my room, and my problem was followed-up on the next day. The human touch is really what makes the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprisel!!!”
Reviews.Author: curtdiloveitaly
Reviews.Content: The Stevenson Manor Inn is a fabuous discovery in a typically overpriced area. We booked this hotel in advance because of the price and location. When we arrived and entered our room we were pleased with the comfortable bed, large TV, free WiFi and granite counters. This was such a welcome relief after a previous hotel experience. The location is within walking distance to the charming town of Calistoga with great dining and fun wine/art boutiques. You are also minutes away from some of thee best wineries in Napa. Make sure to visit Castillo Di Amorosa Winery (a castle imported from Italy) which will make your trip! We extended our stay while we were there and the staff was more than helpful and personable. We will be back again in 2010!

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country Bliss”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTraveler20
Reviews.Content: The Stevenson Manor Inn is a great discovery in a mostly overpriced area. Very clean and recently renovated rooms with comfortable beds, large TV and free WiFi. This beats a fussy B&B any day! The inn is just a few blocks from dining and shops downtown. You could easily walk there in daylight. The staff is very cheerful and personable, which adds to the experience. I've stayed there twice and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for exploring Calistoga and Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: KlausOslo_Norway
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after having studied the reviews on this site. Unfortunately we were able to stay only two nights. The room was new, spacious and clean. The area reserved for breakfast was a bit cramped, you could use the outside area which is great during the Summer. In early October the mornings were too chilly. But breakfasts were good, lots of fruits as well. There's a good parking in front of the entrance. The hotel is situated on the outskirts of Calistoga, about a 10-15 minute walk. Based on our short stay, we can recommend this hotel for exploring Calistoga and its vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Dollar for dollar as good as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: Kellys60
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms here 1 - 4 October as my daughter got married in Calistoga. The rooms were VERY roomy and had everything you would need for a great stay - comfy beds, fridge/microwave. Everything VERY clean as well! The pool was wonderful and we enjoyed both the steam room and sauna. The continental breakfast was very good, lots to eat and it was so nice not to have to travel out for breakfast. The staff was very nice and helpful to everyone. We would certainly stay here again as the distance to Calistoga is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to explore Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: PlannedSpontaneity
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here on our weeklong exploration of Northern California. Calistoga gave us a great jumping off point to tour the Napa Valley. We had stayed here three years ago. Most of the same staff is still here (and remembered us!). That is a rarity in the hospitality industry. The rooms are large and clean. The bed might be due for an upgrade. We woke up with some backaches, but still slept well. The continental breakfast is small but you can shop at the nearby CalMart store for goodies to store in your refrigerator in your room. The pool and spa were kept clean the whole time. The prices are not cheap (nothing is up here) but you do get a good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl36
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at BW Stevenson Manor Inn. Our room was clean, cool (it was near 100 outside during our stay), quiet and roomy. I especially loved the staff...what a great bunch of gals! They went out of their way to accomodate us. They also made reservations for us at our next destination, which we cancelled, then had them re-book again. They took it all in stride with a lot of apologies from my husband and me. Everyone was friendly, form the gardening staff, cleaning staff to the front desk staff. Even the UPS guy was nice :) Lovely wine and cheese party at night and nice continental breakfast as well. They also have nice pool and courtyard areas. Another plus was a coin opperated washer and dryer for the guest's use.. I'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A charming place at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: sail_into_the_sun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night on our way to San Francisco. I was very impressed with the room- very spaciuos, clean, well-equipped. Comfortable beds. It was nicer than many 4 star properties I have stayed in. There was plenty of room for all 5 of us- 2 double beds and still plenty of space for our portable crib for the baby. There was a fridge and coffee maker in the room. The courtyard is a charming place for a bottle of wine. The kids (and adults) really appreciated the pool. Breakfast was nothing special, but typical of the buffet you get at most similar chains. Don't be put off by the distance to the main strip of restaurants/ bars in town- it is really only a 5 minute walk and we had no problems doing it with young children. I would defiantely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, clean hotel in great town”
Reviews.Author: dccnm
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was initially disappointed since it seemed smaller than the website pictures and was right on the road. We asked for a room facing the hills and were pleased to see that is what we got. The room was large, clean and well appointed--microwave, fridge, wine glasses and corkscrew. Comfy bed, large flat screen TV, and breakfast included. Fresh cut up fruit, cereal, granola, muffins, hardboiled eggs, bagels, bread, juice, coffee and tea. Computer in the breakfast area with internet and printer, wifi (free) in the room. The wifi had a few glitches (we had to call the tech support number the front desk provided), but after the call, all was well. Short walk to great town. Since the town is pretty quiet, the fact that the hotel is right on the road is not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise topped by more surprises”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: Last month, my wife and children surprised me with a 3 night stay in Calistoga as a Father's Day gift. As residents of American Canyon at the southern end of the Napa Valley, Calistoga is just far enough away to feel like you're getting away. Assisting in this feeling were the accommodations at Stevenson Manor. I was very impressed with the clean, crisp, almost sleek look of the room. Not sure if they were recently remodeled, but ours was fantastic. The kids loved the room's flat screen TV we had, and my wife enjoyed the spaciousness of it. One area which could be improved is the eating area where the continental breakfast is served. The breakfast options were plentiful and had something for the whole family, but when we got our food, there were no open tables to sit. Luckily, one of the staff members recommended taking our food out to the inn's sun-splashed courtyard. We were able to take advantage of the beautiful weather even more, and it offered the kids space to run around while we finished our breakfast. Monday morning came too quick, but the in-room high speed Wi-Fi allowed me to sign-in for my morning sales call and in room coffee grinder/maker made me functional during it. All the while, my kids got to steal one more dip into the pool before we had to head out. What a treat and spending it at Stevenson Manor was a huge part of it. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “One cannot find a better place to conduct business or impress colleagues.”
Reviews.Author: INSURANCE9
Reviews.Content: Calistoga is a quaint little town . I needed a place to entertain business associates as well as a place to stay. The rooms were excellent for all us. They were immaculately maintained and spacious. The front desk employees were all efficient, friendly, and most helpful to myself and my friends. It was so nice to get away from the city and we will definitely go back for our next meeting as well as just for fun and comfort. William C. Weagle - & Associates Insurance Agency

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs party”
Reviews.Author: atop
Reviews.Content: This is a nightmare of a trip. The bedbugs were huge and ready to have feast as soon as we showed up in our room #207 on 6/22/09. This was yesterday, today I am writing this review to warn other not to stay at this hotel and pray for us to survive this ordeal, as we are staying here until 6/26/09. The hotel clerk moved us to another room (#212), which made us feel little better, however all throughout the night I had horrible nightmares of bedbugs with their little dinner plates dancing around our bed. I woke up several times during the night in cold sweat. I am never coming back to this hole.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and elegant”
Reviews.Author: LengraMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is just a couple of minutes walk from the centre of town. On arrival we we upgraded to a fireplace room which was wonderful. The Hotel is spotless and very tastefully furnished. Our room looked out over the mountain range. Breakfast was included and a good range of foods were on offer. The room was quiet and inviting. A large plasma TV screen was most welcomed. We would definetely recomend this hotel. A large heated pool and spa were on offer and kept very clean, our bed was comfortable with good quality pillows which seem to be a rarity these days. Overall had a great experience and thoroughly enjoyed exploring the charming town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good deal.”
Reviews.Author: CA7777
Reviews.Content: I made a last minute reservation at this hotel, and it did not disappoint. It was nice to find a hotel which did not lie when it used the term "walking distance." This really is the perfect location for people who want to explore the charming town of Calistoga on foot, and still have a quiet place to sleep. Easy walks to spas, restaurants, wine shops, and bars. The room was very spacious with very comfortable bed, and a nice refrigerator and sink for picnic preparations. The coffee in the lobby was so good that I never used the fancy coffee-grinding-drip machine in my room. The bathroom was huge, with good towels, and nice toiletries. I did not try the continental breakfast, due to early morning trips down to St. Helena's Model Bakery, but the spread looked good. The service was friendly, and they even put up a sign to warn guests about daylight savings time change. No hassle chek-in and check-out, with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Best Western”
Reviews.Author: LeonardSkinner
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was consistently good... the continental breakfast was great (as far as continental breakfasts go)... and the rooms were very nice with great amenities. Everything was very clean and the hotel is a great value. We would definitely stay again given how good of a value it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and experience!”
Reviews.Author: GalInSF
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely exceeded our expectations and delivered on the value I had hoped. We stayed in a King room with fireplace. The furnishings seemed updated including some touches that you do not often find at a typical Best Western - soft pillows, down blanket, wine glasses, mini-bar including fridge and microwave, nice toiletries, and a good quality 32" flat screen (though no bathrobes, which would have been a nice touch too!). The hotel itself is located just a short distance away from the main area shops and restaurants. We decided to drive into dinner at Jole (highly recommend this restaurant) but walked to breakfast in the morning. Even though it was drizzling a bit, it was a refreshing walk (recommend the Roastery for a light breakfast to augment the continental one you get at the hotel). We loved Calistoga and the Stevenson Manor definitely contributed to a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Spectacular Value”
Reviews.Author: steelersdominate
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean rooms, courteous staff and perfect location for a nice walk into town. Nice grounds with pool, hot tub, steam and sauna. The staff was extremely helpful with suggestions on local activities and the top restaurants in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler123_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early fall and had a fantastic time. Our room was fairly spacious with a fireplace and big window. The room was clean and nicely decorated with flat-screen TV, refrigerator and microwave. It rained while we were here but we didnâ€™t mind. We popped popcorn, lit the fire, curled up on our really comfortable king sized bed and watched movies all night. We loved it and weâ€™ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: UMichAlum
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned when we checked in because the woman at the desk was going on and on with an AC repair man about how they finally had new site managers who had moved into the apartment and then told a whole story of how the former site manager was finally fired for being a drunk! Meanwhile I was standing at the counter until she finished her sad tale of woe! Not good customer service. But once past that we had a wonderful experience! Ask for the 2nd floor room with the little balcony facing the pool. Delightful. Large well appointed room, comfortable bed, good breakfast, good -and clean- guest laundry, and terrific spa and pool. Just on the edge of town. Other guests also commented on "what a wonderful place this is."

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa base”
Reviews.Author: archied
Reviews.Content: Chose the Stevenson Manor based on Tripadvisor reviews. Didn't disappoint. Good value, good rooms, clean, good value breakfast. Best was the very welcoming and friendly staff who made us feel at home and who were very helpful at every point of contact

Reviews.Title: “This place is the WORST”
Reviews.Author: globetrotting_girl08
Reviews.Content: I was pleased to efind a hotel in this price range in Calistoga, and so close to Indian Springs. When we arrived BOTH front desk employees were standing out front smoking cigarettes. The man seemed to have a hard time figuring out his computer, so it took longer than necessary. The room was adequate. It was clean enough and very basic. When I got home yesterday I checked my bank account and was shocked to see they had charged me an extra $500!!!!! on my debit card. I called the property immediately and was told that the maid said someone had smoked in the room. WE DON'T SMOKE!!!! I tried to reason with them, to no avail. This is criminal and I will NEVER stay at a Best Western again. I plan to contest this charge and will take them to small claims court if I have to. Don't stay at this pedestrian corporat hotel. Calistoga has way better places to stay than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Truly Enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: BeachLvr_VT6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while touring Napa Valley. It is located in a great spot and is very easy to access all the vineyards. This hotel is extremely clean and well kept. I am tough to please in the room department and it offered everything you need. It was nice to get up in the morning and go to the desk and get coffee and meet in the seating area with our friends and plan our day. Also after a long day of touring vineyards and a nice dinner it was great to come back to the pool and hot tub! All very clean and well kept. This hotel is priced great and is a pleasure. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: ternstail
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stevenson for three nights and were pleased with the experience. Quiet and convenient location, big room, above average continental breakfast with fresh fruit, and very helpful staff. Had a great time in wine country and look forward to returning to Calistoga and the Stevenson.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Best Western”
Reviews.Author: WanderingStar32
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Large comfortable and clean rooms. Nice grounds with pool, hot tub, steam and sauna. Very short walk to town. Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good experience”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaRachel
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious, but unfortunately didn't have a balcony. The hotel staff was very nice. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows were tiny! One night, I was woken up by the fireplace turning itself on. Apparently, the heater decided that the room was too cold....For a room costing $200/night, I was disappointed to be woken up by a fireplace at 6am. I would stay at this hotel again (now that I know to turn off the thermostat by the fireplace).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: slr_7
Reviews.Content: Lovely place...new modern hotel...clean..large rooms fully furnished with kitchenette and whirlpool tub. Lots of small touches that make it an excellent place to stay. Great breakfast...lots of fresh fruit, granola, good coffee, etc. We enjoyed the pool, jacuzzi and steam room. Exceptional value for such a lovely property. The help are all very pleasant , appreciative and helpful. I would stay here again if I was in the area. Excellent value for the money considering what some places in the Napa Valley want to charge for rather sub-par properties.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: MJSCOTT
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in this hotel, and one night was enough. Although the room itself wasn't bad, the air conditioning was a nightmare. It's ancient, noisy and created a difficult sleeping environment. I can't say that my stay was awful, but I think I'd choose to stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: dale3
